title: questions about dcing?
body:
alright i know i'll probably be flamed for this, and that's alright, however i was wondering if anyone could provide some advice on my situation? my internet will disconnect here and there, maybe three times a month. im looking into getting it fixed, and these disconnections happen at totally random times. i still continue to play ranked games because it's rare for me to disconnect while im actually playing, considering i dont play all day, not all the time. i've had a recent few scares though, and by few i mean two, where i disconnected at the beginning of the game, and within the two minutes it takes me to join back, my team has already voted to remake, which is understandable. right now, i have at least 20 games, i havent counted them all but the last game i was disconnected from isnt in my match history, which shows the last 20 games of course. but i have 20 games of no issues since the last dc, does that mean anything, or help my account from being flagged for the recent dc? i also kinda just wanted to get people's opinions on whether or not i should continue to even try to play, i wanted to know if you guys think its a big risk or not. i havent been notified about my account being potentially banned and just these two recent dc's have really been it, apart from me being banned a few years ago when i first started out on the game and didn't know what i was doing. i'm assuming that doesnt come into play now, since it was years ago, or does it? thanks for any advice you guys can give, i appreciate it a lot. 

i also forgot to mention i did have a game the other night, im sure this one is still in my match history, where i did dc, however for some amazing reason my team didn't remake, and i was able to play out the game and win it. does my account still get flagged despite me coming back? i've always wanted to know.

replies.body:
This uncertainty sounds way too stressful to be worth risking.  On top of the instability of disconnections, you're also risking match losses, [leaverbuster](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752714-LeaverBuster-FAQ), and also hurting those in-game who have to be down a player.  

I'm glad to hear that this is being worked on, but it might be a good day to take a break from matchmaking until it's resolved.  Hopefully your ISP will be able to offer swift assistance in whatever is causing this, but just in case I also recommend the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to troubleshoot.  Just be sure to do it in a custom!
